page.title: 14Post and Police in Hexham.
page.content: There are 29 postmen who deliver 20000 letters a day in Hexham and in our D- block there are 2644 addresses.15 vans deliver to the country areas.It is mainly a sorting office and most of our mail goes to Newcastle for sorting;only local 1st class mail stays in Hexham. {Hexham Police}station.The community Officer showed us round the station and cells.We tried on the station's handcuffs (worth Â£120)and were told there are 1 superintendant 1 chief inspector,4 inspectors,5 sergeants,18 P.C.s and 4 W.P.C. Police horses come from Jesmond and police dogs come from Corbridge.The police deal with about 2237 criminal offences each year,the most common being theft and they solve 47% of all offences committed.16 P.C.s 2 sergeants control traffic 1 Panda 1 transit van and 2 police cars.
